title: Unstructured Data Processor
original_prompt:
You will be provided with the highly unstructured textual data and your task is to be an expert analyst in understanding the context or business that is being dealt and produce the structured information in JSON. Also make sure to embed the sentiments or emotions along with the NER.

{content:Customer: Hi, I’m waiting for my delivery. It was supposed to have arrived three days ago. Can you give me an update? Advisor: Thanks for getting in touch with us. I am sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused. What is your order reference number? Customer: What’s that? Advisor: It should be on your confirmation letter. Customer: Okay, let me check… Customer: 1234567 Customer: Are you still there? Advisor: Yes. I am entering the number into our EFQB online tracking system, which is running a little slow today. Advisor: Did you know that you can check this yourself at www.csupport.co.uk Customer: No. Advisor: According to the system that order will be delivered today between 3-5pm. Customer: That’s annoying because I’m out then and how do I know that it will actually arrive. Advisor: I am sorry that you feel that way. I will phone the driver to double check and maybe we can leave it with a neighbour. Would that be okay? Customer: I suppose. Advisor: The driver is running on time and they will leave it with your neighbour. Customer: Okay, thanks.}
input1: {content: Customer: I received my order yesterday, but it was missing a few items. I ordered a set of kitchen utensils and a blender, but only the utensils arrived. Advisor: I apologize for the inconvenience. Can you provide me with your order number? Customer: Sure, it’s 9876543. Advisor: Thank you. Let me check the details for you. Customer: I really need the blender for a dinner party this weekend. Advisor: I understand how important that is. It looks like the blender was out of stock at the time of shipping. Customer: That’s frustrating! Advisor: I can arrange for a replacement to be sent out immediately. Would that work for you? Customer: Yes, please. Advisor: I will expedite the shipping, and you should receive it by tomorrow. Customer: Thank you for your help!}
input2: {content: Customer: I tried to return a pair of shoes I bought last month, but the store said they couldn’t process my return because I lost the receipt. Advisor: I’m sorry to hear that. Can you tell me the order number or the date of purchase? Customer: I think it was around the 15th of last month, but I’m not sure. Advisor: Let me check our records for that date. Customer: I really liked those shoes, but they just didn’t fit right. Advisor: I understand how disappointing that can be. If we can’t find the order, we can still offer you store credit. Customer: That would be fine, but I’d prefer a refund. Advisor: I will do my best to locate your order and see if we can process a refund. Customer: Thank you, I appreciate it!}
